channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: U.S. sled racer Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied sixth Olympic bid
item.description: Five-time U.S. Olympian Katie Uhlaender says a point-manipulation scheme blocked her bid to compete in Milan Cortina. U.S. sports officials are backing her bid for a special berth at the Winter Games.
item.content:encoded:
Five-time U.S. Olympian Katie Uhlaender says a point-manipulation scheme blocked her bid to compete in Milan Cortina. U.S. sports officials are backing her bid for a special berth at the Winter Games.

(Image credit: Al Bello)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Amid lawsuits and protests, Trump signals changes to Minnesota immigration surge
item.description: A federal judge on Monday considered the legality of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in Minneapolis, where backlash has intensified after federal agents shot and killed two U.S. citizens this month.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge on Monday considered the legality of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in Minneapolis, where backlash has intensified after federal agents shot and killed two U.S. citizens this month.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Treasury cancels Booz Allen contracts over leaks about wealthy taxpayers
item.description: A Booz Allen contractor had leaked confidential tax information that showed how wealthy people like Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos manage to minimize their tax obligations.
item.content:encoded:
A Booz Allen contractor had leaked confidential tax information that showed how wealthy people like Donald Trump, Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos manage to minimize their tax obligations.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Josh Shapiro sees light in his constituents, even in dark times
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Democratic Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania about his memoir, Where We Keep the Light, immigration raids and the upcoming elections in 2026 and 2028.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with Democratic Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania about his memoir, Where We Keep the Light, immigration raids and the upcoming elections in 2026 and 2028.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Handel

item.title: Hundreds of thousands without power in the U.S. after a powerful winter storm
item.description: A powerful winter storm walloped a huge swath of the U.S., killing at least 25 people. Electricity is out for hundreds of thousands, and freezing rain and snow have coated streets.
item.content:encoded:
A powerful winter storm walloped a huge swath of the U.S., killing at least 25 people. Electricity is out for hundreds of thousands, and freezing rain and snow have coated streets.

(Image credit: Brett Carlsen)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Ukrainians are sharing hacks online on how to survive winter power cuts
item.description: After repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy grid, Ukrainians face long outages during a cold winter at war. On social media, Ukrainians share tips for keeping warm at home.
item.content:encoded:
After repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy grid, Ukrainians face long outages during a cold winter at war. On social media, Ukrainians share tips for keeping warm at home.

(Image credit: Andrew Kravchenko)
item.dc:creator: Hanna Palamarenko

item.title: Israel finds the last hostage body in Gaza, paving the way for next steps in Trump plan
item.description: The Israeli military says the body of Ran Gvili, a 24-year-old special forces policeman killed while fighting Hamas militants on Oct. 7, 2023, has been found.
item.content:encoded:
The Israeli military says the body of Ran Gvili, a 24-year-old special forces policeman killed while fighting Hamas militants on Oct. 7, 2023, has been found.

(Image credit: Ilia Yefimovich)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Julian Barnes' playful new book is also his 'official departure'
item.description: Departure(s) explores several of Barnes' lifelong obsessions — mortality, memory, and time. It's slim but weighty, digressive yet incisive. Barnes, who just turned 80, says it will be his last.
item.content:encoded: Departure(s) explores several of Barnes' lifelong obsessions — mortality, memory, and time. It's slim but weighty, digressive yet incisive. Barnes, who just turned 80, says it will be his last.
item.dc:creator: Heller McAlpin

item.title: How long do you need to spend in the gym to get strong? Less than you think
item.description: If you're procrastinating working out, here's one less excuse. Short gym sessions can be enough to build meaningful strength — as long as you push yourself while you're there.
item.content:encoded: If you're procrastinating working out, here's one less excuse. Short gym sessions can be enough to build meaningful strength — as long as you push yourself while you're there.
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: All eyes are on Rubio as he navigates the world in 2 critical roles
item.description: Rubio is the first person to hold both roles at the same time since Secretary of State Henry Kissinger in the 1970s.
item.content:encoded:
Rubio is the first person to hold both roles at the same time since Secretary of State Henry Kissinger in the 1970s.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez
